notes.text:
Don't overbake - they should be slightly gooey
A skewer should come out with moist crumbs
Let cool fully for clean cuts

steps.descr: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F), line a baking tin

on_enter.say: Right, let's get started by preheating the oven to 180°C. Make sure to line your baking tin with parchment paper, so nothing sticks!

steps.instructions: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F), line a baking tin

on_enter.say: Now, let's melt the chocolate and butter together. Stir it gently until it's smooth and glossy.
Brilliant! Now whisk in the sugar until it's all beautifully combined.

steps.descr: Beat in eggs one at a time

on_enter.say: Let's beat in the eggs, one at a time. This will give us a lovely, rich batter.

steps.instructions: Beat in eggs one at a time

steps.descr: Fold in flour, cocoa, and salt

on_enter.say: Gently fold in the flour, cocoa, and a pinch of salt. Be careful not to overmix, just until it's combined.

steps.instructions: Fold in flour, cocoa, and salt

steps.descr: Pour into tin and bake for 25-30 minutes

on_enter.say: Pour the batter into your prepared tin and pop it in the oven. We'll bake it for 25 to 30 minutes. You'll know it's done when the top is crackly and a skewer comes out with moist crumbs.

steps.instructions: Pour into tin and bake for 25-30 minutes

steps.descr: Cool completely before cutting into squares

on_enter.say: Fantastic! Let the brownies cool completely in the tin before cutting them into squares. This will give you those perfect, clean edges.

steps.instructions: Cool completely before cutting into squares

recipe.title: Chocolate Brownies
recipe.description: Fudgy, rich chocolate brownies with a crackly top
